result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon P. Wegner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -  $443 ($243 costs and $200 DNA surcharge) to be paid on a pay plan of $100 per month starting 11/30/2016.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 10 days jail consecutive with Huber.

-  45 days jail consecutive to any other sentence in being with Huber commencing 10/19/2016 at 5pm.   

The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.
 
-  DNA sample compliance. 

Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon P. Wegner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:35am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Jon P. Wegner in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
Count #2 - NO CONTEST  plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.
State moves to read-in and dismiss Count #1; so ordered by the Court. 
Recommendations presented by Counsel.
The Court orders:
-  45 days jail consecutive to any other sentence in being with Huber commencing 10/19/2016 at 5pm.   The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.
-  $443 ($243 costs and $200 DNA surcharge) to be paid on a pay plan of $100 per month starting 11/30/2016.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 10 days jail consecutive with Huber. 
-  DNA sample compliance. 

Bond continued until jail commencement. 
Recess 8:51am
Court trial on October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 11:25 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jon P. Wegner in court with Attorney Larry David Steen. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Steen informs the Court that the matter has not yet been resolved, would like to waive jury trial and have Court Trial in front of Judge Koschnick
Court reviews constitutional rights with Mr. Wegner. Mr. Wegner confirms waiver of jury trial. Court finds that Mr. Wegner's waiver of jury trial has been made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Counsel agree 1 day will be needed for Court trial
Court reminds Mr. Wegner that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending.
Recess: 11:29 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Court Trial 10/5/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on June 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:24am. 
Defendant Jon P. Wegner in court with Attorney Larry D Steen.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Pleasof "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

The Court requires $1,000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Rachel Marinez or her minor children
--no presence at any residence at which Rachel Marinez resides
recess 9:26am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/23/16 at 11:00am   (2)  Status Conference on 6/17/16 at 11:00am
